reviews.text: On the positive side the beds are extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Disappointing and unbelievably long check out time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not really any discernable difference between the 3* and 4* rooms that we booked - if anything the 3* one was slightly nicer (4* room had very tatty rug in it which impacted on the overall look of the room).
reviews.title: Miles from anywhere and tries too hard

reviews.text: The bathrooms have been mentioned a lot on previous reviews - the system of opening the cupboard doors to create an enclosed bathroom is quite innovative and different and we worked out how to use it pretty quickly. I can understand why some people didn't though and think it would make sense for people checking into those rooms to be told how the bathroom works when they check in to avoid confusion.
reviews.title: The most impractical hotel on the planet

reviews.text: We arrived to find that we couldn't check in until 3.00pm at the weekend, which hadn't been made clear when the reservation was made and was a bit of a hassle as we'd intended to get changed before heading out for the afternoon. Again - would make sense to just let people know that the check in time is fairly late on in the afternoon so there are no surprises.
reviews.title: Interesting Altenative in Amsterdam

likes.disliked: — price- 50 EUR less and it would be a great deal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the website gives a much better impression of the hotel than the reality. I like quirky hotels, but they can be done a lot better than this. A comparable example would be the Malmaison hotel in Oxford which was an old prison and has retained it's quirkiness and character, but has significantly higher quality decor, facilities and service for the same price as a 3* star room in this hotel.
reviews.title: Former Prison that has not changed much

reviews.text: I booked this under a mistaken recommendation, apparently the LLoyd is a popular name for a hotel! I was also pretty impressed by the 5* room photos on the hotel's website so I thought I'd give it a whirl.
reviews.title: Weird
Love it or hate it, I really liked it
reviews.text: After waiting for 10 minutes for the receptionist (sitting in a booth not much larger than a London phone box) to finish her phone call, I was able to scruitinize the dining room and the grotty tiles lining the floor of this former prison. For the next 12 hours (thank goodness) of my stay this was always in the back of my mind.

reviews.title: Stylish, quirky, different...
reviews.text: My room had a quirky, sauna-esque tinterior with a bed big enough for 8 people! (It was a great shame I was staying alone). The bathroom was a lurid green which the most uncomfortable looking bath I've ever seen.

reviews.title: Oh My God!
reviews.text: In short I wouldn't stay here again, but it was an experience!
I loved my 3-star room, because I like minimalist design. It was big, interesting and I found Al Jazeera English on the TV channels.
reviews.title: not as nice as I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having been in Amsterdam before i was aware that many of the hotels are small, some expensive for the state of the room presented. So it was refreshing to find the lloyds hotel close to Central Station and which looked a good standard of accomodation. On arrival my husband and I were allocated a room on the top floor, the whole area entering our rooms seemed so remote from the rest of the hotel and the room was so dark, as the windows were high any view was only achieved by standing on a chair. I knew I could not stay a night in such a room.
reviews.title: 2 nights wished it was two weeks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to reception and explained and was given the keys of another room wihout any fuss and was told it was important that guests were happy.
reviews.title: First impressions.

reviews.text: Our next room on the second floor was aboslutely beautiful, all in white with designer furnishings, so light and airy. The rest of the hotel was great, a library for guests with an amazing range of art literature, the resturant is slightly exensive but he service was good and the bar had a cheery barman. I would recommend and certainly return to Lloyds.
reviews.title: Out of the ordinary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lloyd hotel in Amsterdam is 40 minutes walk from central and 10 euros taxi ride, trams 25 and 26 run nearby.
reviews.title: A Must-See if you appreciate Art/Design or just want something different

likes.liked: — high design, unique, off the beaten tourist-track
likes.disliked: — when we first got there the room smelled kind of funny, like stale water

reviews.text: Anyways, the cheapest rooms are like prison cells they havent changed them much in the revamp( from a prison!). We waited 30 minutes at reception to check in, this was from 15.30 to 16.00 as rooms were not ready!!!!
reviews.title: No Class

likes.disliked: — there was no shower curtain so the water just spilled!!

reviews.text: The Lloyd hotel is a nice place, in a decent location, and staffed with some nice people. The history of the building is interesting
reviews.title: Nice Stay - but not 'Exceptional'

likes.liked: — The clean room, secluded location, and friendly staff

reviews.title: loved the lloyd
reviews.text: and my walk around the area (this being low season) was not

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: incredible - but was pleasant. The best thing about the hotel is
reviews.title: unforgettable horrible

reviews.text: that it is clean and open - and somewhat secluded. The pricing
reviews.title: Interesting

likes.disliked: — location--a bit far from sights/places to eat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: is not bad for low season. However, the thing to watch out for (and this is demonstrated in some of the other guest complaints) is the unique way in which the hotel categorizes the rooms. I booked for 3 nights and was happy with my room. But, being a category 4 room I expected something a bit more than what I got - it was basic and not interesting- certainly not exceptional. There is much said about the interiors and furniture, etc... but I found that much of it is hyperbole. There is much difference between a 1 and a 5 perhaps - but I suggest you pay close attention to anything in between. Many of the rooms are not much of an improvement on
reviews.title: comfy beds

likes.disliked: — can't see out the window unless you stand on a chair
